content.description:
Start at the right edge of the Right Buttress and follow an obvious line up and left to finish at the top of

Thin Spin

.
content.location: Start at the right edge of the Right Buttress.

content.description:
Start in the gully about 40 feet uphill and left of

James Brown's Celebrity Hot Tub Party

and below the

Gear Thief

. Climb a grainy slab to a left facing flake in a corner. Layback up the flake to under a ceiling. Step right and pull the ceiling at a crack (crux). Climb the loose face above to the top of the formation.
content.location:
Start in the gully about 40 feet uphill and left of

James Brown's Celebrity Hot Tub Party

.

content.description: A clean, enjoyable thin crack, with face moves and jamming on good rock. There is a two bolt belay/rappel anchor on top.
content.location: A bit right of the center of Vagmarken Hill

climbs.name: Right-Handed Dyke
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Reggie Thompson, Karen Long, and Linda Moran (Oct. 1990)

content.description: This route climbs the Right Dike with an adjacent thin crack to the left on the Vagamarket Hill-Right Buttress and deserves an R rating because pro is nearly nonexistent.  The 5.10a part of the climb is for the first 40 feet of the climb and then eases off for the next 60.  Fun moves but short lived, and recommended to toprope, but that's your call.  About 100' up the climb 15 feet to the right of the headwall for James Brown's... there's a splitter crack to set a toprope anchor where you'll need cams to 3 inches (BD #1,2,and 3, 2's worked best).  Setting them high in the crack made the rope run pretty good.
content.protection: Cams to 3 inches for the top of the climb and the anchor, no idea what would work for the first 30' of the 10a part.

climbs.name: Probably Been Climbed Before
climbs.fa: Unknown or me and Dave, probably somebody else

content.description: We did this climb simply to toprope Right-Handed Dyke, but it turned out to be somewhat interesting for the grade, probably PG though.  Start up the crack and stay right and out of the dihedral that James Brown's... uses, moving out to the arete.  Climb the arete up and right until you get to a splitter crack that is about 15 feet long and to the right of James Brown's... headwall.  Set your anchor at the top of the crack and this anchor can be used for this climb and for Right-Handed Dyke.

Start 8' left of

Right Handed Dyke

and 4' right of an easy crack on the arête. Climb up the steep face on knobs and flakes for 20 feet (crux). Continue up the lower angled rounded arête to join

Right Handed Dyke

just before a big ledge.
content.location:
Start 8' left of

Right Handed Dyke

and 4' right of an easy crack on the arête

climbs.name: James Brown's Celebrity Hot Tub Party
climbs.fa: Geoff Archer, Todd Gordon & Alan Bartlett, April 1991

content.description: This route climbs the left of two slanting dikes and is on the left edge of the face of Vagamarket Hill-Right Buttress.  It starts in an easy crack and moves up the face to headwall with a difficult reachy roof move which is protected by the first of two bolts.  The first bolt is a move away for the vertically challenged and the second bolt is about 5 feet above the first.  The rest of the climb to the top follows the dike and has "so-so protection."
content.protection: Cams to  2 inches, and two bolts

climbs.name: The Gear Thief
climbs.fa: Alan Bartlett, Amy Sharpless, and Tom Budd (April 1991)

content.description: There is a left slanting dike on the left side of the climb. The crack slants right and then goes back up and left. There is one loose block in the climb, but the rest is pretty solid and somewhat steep for a 5.6. You can sling a horn at the top to belay the second.
content.location: This route is on the left side of Right Buttress in the gully about 50 feet up and left of James Brown's Celebrity Hot Tub Party (the start is about even in height of where the first bolt is).

content.description:
Climb the low-angled crack just right of

Thin Spin

to the top..
content.location: Start just right of Thin Spin.

content.description:
This route is about 10 feet to the right of Thin Spin and is well worth doing if you're in the area.  Start by climbing up a trough and come out on the slab.  It's a little bit before you can get some pro in without worrying about rope drag.  After that, there's a continuous crack (with others around) that goes up through the roof above.  Good roof move and then follow the crack up and left above a bush.  The exit has a bit of loose rock to watch out for.

There's a crack above 20 feet back that you can get big cams (4-5) in to anchor to belay the follower, otherwise, there's a boulder ten feet back you can sling.  Its a walk-off to the skiers left down the gully in between Wrong Buttress and Right Buttress.

Start eight feet right of

Right Handed Dyke

at a scoop.

P1: Climb up ten feet into the scoop, then go up to a large horizontal dike (crux). Continue up the lower angled face to a short, varnished right facing corner (wires) about 80 feet up. Belay above on a ledge (#3 Friends for anchor - 5.7X).

P2: Step right on the ledge and scramble up 15 feet to a short varnished dihedral. Climb this dihedral to the top (5.3 - 45 feet).

Descend down the gully to the right (east).

Paul was in town to judge a dog show at the Indio Polo Grounds.
content.location:
Start just right of

Right Handed Dyke

.
